com.commercetools.sunrise.hooks

Interface HookRunner

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HookContext, RequestHookContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RequestHookContextImpl

    public interface HookRunner

    • Method Detail

      • runEventHook

        <H extends Hook> java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?> runEventHook(java.lang.Class<H> hookClass,
                                                                      java.util.function.Function<H,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?>> f)
        Executes a hook which takes 0 to n parameters and returns a CompletionStage. The execution (just the creation of the CompletionStage) is synchronous and each implementing component will be called after each other and does not wait for the CompletionStage to be completed. The underlying computation to complete the CompletionStage can be asynchronous and should run in parallel for the components. The result should be completed at some point and a successful completion can also contain the value null hence the successful result is not used directly by the framework. Before the hook PageDataReadyHook is called, all asynchronous computations for the requests need to be completed successfully.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of the hook
        Parameters:
        hookClass - the class which represents the hook
        f - a possible asynchronous computation using the hook
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage which is completed successfully if all underlying components completed successfully with this hook, otherwise a exceptionally completed CompletionStage

      • runActionHook

        <H extends Hook,R> java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<R> runActionHook(java.lang.Class<H> hookClass,
                                                                         java.util.function.BiFunction<H,R,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<R>> f,
                                                                         R param)

      • runUnaryOperatorHook

        <H extends Hook,R> R runUnaryOperatorHook(java.lang.Class<H> hookClass,
                                          java.util.function.BiFunction<H,R,R> f,
                                          R param)
        Executes a hook with one parameter that returns a value of the same type as the parameter. The execution is synchronous and each implementing component will be called after each other. A typical use case is to use this as filter especially in combination with "withers".
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of the hook
        R - the type of the parameter
        Parameters:
        hookClass - the class which represents the hook
        f - a computation (filter) that takes the hook and the parameter of type R as argument and returns a computed value of the type R
        param - the initial parameter for the filter
        Returns:
        the result of the filter chain, if there is no hooks then it will be the parameter itself, if there are multiple hooks then it will be applied like this: f3(f2(f1(initialParameter)))

      • runConsumerHook

        <H extends Hook> void runConsumerHook(java.lang.Class<H> hookClass,
                                      java.util.function.Consumer<H> consumer)
        Executes a hook which takes 0 to n parameters and returns nothing. The execution is synchronous and each implementing component will be called after each other. This is normally used to achieve side effects.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of the hook
        Parameters:
        hookClass - the class which represents the hook
        consumer - a computation that takes the hook instance as parameter which represents executing the hook
